page.title: 08Vandalism on Bretch Hill.
page.content: Vandalism is the largest problem in the Bretch Hill Area of Banbury. The most common forms are window smashing and graffiti. These are done mainly by children and teenagers between the age of 5 and 20. Sometimes children younger than 5 years old are involved when they are with older children. Recently one of the local schools had some windows broken, and the window sills written on with marker pen. It cost nearly three hundred pounds to put it right. Most of the Community Policemans time is taken up with visits to parents or people who have made complaints about children either playing football, and cricket in the street, riding m/cycles across the recreation ground or just generally being a nuisance. Friday and Saturday nights are the busiest when the older teenagers and those in their early twenties have been drinking.
